alert.note: Alert for Levy (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 3:15PM EDT until June 09 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Florida, including the following county, Levy. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williston, Chiefland, Bronson, East Bronson, Williston Highlands, Manattee Road, Andrews, Fowlers Bluff, Williston Municipal Airport, Inglis, Fanning Springs, Otter Creek, Lebanon and Manatee Springs State Park. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
